verses.verse: (A Psalm of David.) O Lord, <WH3068> I call <WH7121> upon Thee; hasten <WH2363> to me! Give <WH238> ear <WH238> to my voice <WH6963> when I call <WH7121> to Thee!
May my prayer <WH8605> be counted <WH3559> as incense <WH7004> before <WH6440> Thee; The lifting <WH4864> up of my hands <WH3709> as the evening <WH6153> offering. <WH4503>
Set <WH7896> a guard, <WH8108> O Lord, <WH3068> over my mouth; <WH6310> Keep <WH5341> watch <WH5341> over <WH5921> the door <WH9087> of my lips. <WH8193>

Do not incline <WH5186> my heart <WH3820> to any evil <WH7451> thing, <WH1697> To practice <WH9412> deeds <WH9412> of wickedness <WH7562> With men <WH376> who do <WH6466> iniquity; <WH205> And do not let me eat <WH9237> of their delicacies. <WH4516>

Let the righteous <WH6662> smite <WH1986> me in kindness <WH2617> and reprove <WH3198> me; It is oil <WH8081> upon the head; <WH7218> Do not let my head <WH7218> refuse <WH5106> it, For still <WH5750> my prayer <WH8605> is against their wicked <WH9567> deeds. <WH9567>
Their judges <WH8199> are thrown <WH8058> down <WH8058> by the sides <WH3027> of the rock, <WH5553> And they hear <WH8085> my words, <WH561> for they are pleasant. <WH5276>
As when one plows <WH6398> and breaks <WH1234> open <WH1234> the earth, <WH776> Our bones <WH6106> have been scattered <WH6340> at the mouth <WH6310> of Sheol. <WH7585>
For my eyes <WH5869> are toward <WH413> Thee, O God, <WH3068> the Lord; <WH136> In Thee I take <WH2620> refuge; <WH2620> do not leave <WH6168> me defenseless. <WH6168> <WH5315>
Keep <WH8104> me from the jaws <WH3027> of the trap <WH6341> which they have set <WH3369> for me, And from the snares <WH4170> of those who do <WH6466> iniquity. <WH205>
Let the wicked <WH7563> fall <WH5307> into their own nets, <WH4364> While <WH5704> I pass <WH5674> by safely. <WH3162>
